result.execSummary:
The defendant Clayton M. Mueller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes: To be taken from 25% of prison monies.
Obtain or maintain full time employment or part time employment if enrolled in school.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms or body armor.
Provide DNA sample on 2-18-16.
Pay DNA surcharge.

No contact with H.D., B.S. or D.B.
No contact with anyone using illegal drugs, except in the context of NA or AA meetings.
No illegal drugs or prescription drugs, except those prescribed by a physician and approved by agent.
Absolute sobriety - cannot be in any place that sells alcohol.

Payment of any restitution, court obligations and DOC supervision fees.
Anger management assessment.
Undergo assessments, treatments and aftercare as deemed necessary by agent.
